questions.question_text: A Linux administrator is helping the security team troubleshoot an SELinux policy violation incident. Which of the following would be the BEST utility command to display SELinux violation and AVC denial messages?

discussion.content:
Correct Answer B. sealert -a /var/log/audit/audit.log

You can investigate SELinux issues without any tools by opening the audit log it generates. This log is found at /var/log/audit/audit.log. 
To run sealert from the command-line, we need to point it to the SELinux audit log.

sealert -a /var/log/audit/audit.log

questions.question_text: A systems administrator received a request to change the hostname to a new name. Which of the following file configurations should be changed to fix the hostname in the server?

An administrator notices the HISTSIZE variable is 50, using the commands below:

HISTSIZE=50 -
export HISTSIZE
The administrator rechecks the HISTSIZE value using echo HISTSIZE but gets no value. Which of the following commands should the administrator use to retrieve its value?

comments.content:
it is correct. 
printenv | grep $HISTSIZE
will show strings which start with HISTSIZE
printenv | grep HISTSIZE
will show all strings which contain HISTSIZE

discussion.content:
A. printenv | grep $HISTSIZE
B. echo HISTSIZE

Gah! There's probably a typo in the answers:
It would be better to 
A. printenv | grep HISTSIZE
B. echo $HISTSIZE
(note how the '$' symbols have moved) and then either A or B should work as an answer.

Correct Answer: A. printenv | grep $HISTSIZE

This is the only command that works on my Red Hat VM. 
None of these work on my Ubuntu. echo $HISTSIZE does work but that is not an option.
Tested A and it works. Returned a $HISTSIZE of 1000 on my system.
A is correct. I tested it

None of them is valid. "A" will work only if HISTSIZE was correctly defined (along with a bunch of additional lines that may include the word "50"). But we don't know that for sure. The proper way to do this is "echo $HISTFILE".

echo HISTSIZE will print HISTSIZE, so it can't be B. 
Definitely A.
